timeline.bodyText: If you are using gRPC stream, you should use wait for the onComplete event to avoid the memory leak. What do you think?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: Don't add @author, all these will be removed by @kezhenxu94 's PR once for all.

timeline.bodyText: equals and hashCode methods could be replaced by Lombok annotation: @EqualsAndHashCode(callSuper = false)
timeline.author: JohnNiang

timeline.bodyText: There is a connection leak here, the old one should be closed.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: I think we should not create stub and connect every time. Right?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: But, we should reconnect when client settings changed.
replies.author: JaredTan95

replies.bodyText: We should, but, the setting could not change here.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: There may be thread-visibility issue,  org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.core.exporter.ExportStatus#done is not volatile, BTW, ExportStatus can be annotated with Lombok annotations
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: Yes, I agree. I missed that last time.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
ExportStatus is in exporter, why use it in the alarm?

Maybe a CountDownLatch is enough to make it more convenient and safe (in terms of thread visibility)?
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: It works, or move ExportStatus to higher-level package, such as library-util.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Considering exporter grpc(
  
    
      skywalking/oap-server/exporter/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/exporter/provider/grpc/GRPCExporter.java
    
    
         Line 173
      in
      5b255ba
    
    
    
    

        
          
           while (!status.isDone()) { 
        
    
  

)  have the same problem and for reuse ExportStatus, move to higher-level package looks good.

timeline.author: kezhenxu94

timeline.bodyText: ExportStatus is in exporter, why use it in the alarm?

timeline.bodyText: What if the user delete the gRPC hooks entirely? Say target host and port is empty
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

timeline.bodyText: Alarm is rare in most cases, this client may be lazily initialized (in doAlarm method)?
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: If that, GRPCClient instance will be initialized every time indoAlarm mthoid, may not appropriate.
replies.author: JaredTan95

replies.bodyText:
If that, GRPCClient instance will be initialized every time indoAlarm mthoid, may not appropriate.

Of course you should take care whether the client is initialized or not
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: Anyway, not important thing, mark as resolved

timeline.bodyText: FYI @kezhenxu94 By following your style, do we have a format way to make sure all these imports are in the same order rather than different people using different orders.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
FYI @kezhenxu94 By following your style, do we have a format way to make sure all these imports are in the same order rather than different people using different orders.

Following the codeStyle.xml, the import order is deterministic, these changes are expected because I didn't format them before

replies.bodyText: Got it. I was expected the format check will do in a strict way, it will make the changelog more clear for everyone.
